articles.author: Jack Queen, Luc Cohen, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: The former president will hear prosecutors explain why his alleged cover-up of a hush money payment to a porn star during his 2016 campaign broke the law.
articles.title: Trump hush-money trial kicks off with opening statements in New York

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Charlotte Bruneau
articles.description: For the exhausted Ukrainian artillery gunners holding off Russian forces near the eastern town of Kupiansk, the U.S. aid package expected to finally pass this week is a lifeline and, potentially, a gamechanger, although that could take some time.
articles.title: Russia-Ukraine war: What difference will US aid package make?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: By Nidal al-Mughrabi and Ramadan Abed
articles.title: Israeli troops storm back into eastern Khan Younis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of Israeli military intelligence, Major General Aharon Haliva, has resigned and will leave once a successor is appointed, the military said in a statement on Monday.
articles.title: Israeli military intelligence head resigns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. forces in Iraq and Syria faced two separate rocket and explosive drone attacks in less than 24 hours, Iraqi security sources and U.S. officials told Reuters on Monday, the first reported after a near three-month pause.
articles.title: Drone, rocket attacks targeted US forces in Iraq, US officials say

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: The U.S. State Department's annual human rights assessment found "significant" abuses in India's northeastern Manipur state last year and attacks on minorities, journalists and dissenting voices in the rest of the country.
articles.title: US rights report on India cites abuses in Manipur, harassment of media and minorities

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police arrested dozens of people at a pro-Palestinian demonstration at Yale University on Monday, hours after Columbia University canceled in-person classes in response to protesters setting up tent encampments at its New York City campus last week.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian protesters arrested at Yale, Columbia cancels in-person classes

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: Beijing is continuing to commit genocide and crimes against humanity against Uyghurs and other Muslim minorities in its western Xinjiang province, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said in a report published on Monday, ahead of his planned visit to China this week.
articles.title: Blinken says genocide in Xinjiang is ongoing in report ahead of China visit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 80 earthquakes, the strongest of 6.3 magnitude, struck Taiwan's east coast starting Monday night and into the early hours of Tuesday and some caused shaking of buildings in the capital Taipei, the island's weather administration said.
articles.title: Series of earthquakes rattle Taiwan, centred on east coast

articles.author: Andrey Sychev, Rachel More
articles.description: Three German nationals have been arrested on suspicion of working with the Chinese secret service to hand over technology that could be used for military purposes, prosecutors said on Monday.
articles.title: Germany arrests three people suspected of giving technology to China
